options.label: D
options.text: Because the temperature of the system increases.

What is the function of the penis in some South American species of crane flies?

options.label: A
options.text: To produce a song that reverberates through the female's body

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of the drumsticks on the penis of some beetles?

options.label: D
options.text: To create a sensation during mating

multiple-choice.question: Why do females have evolved to control their own sperm management?

options.label: A
options.text: To create genetic variability among their offspring

options.label: B
options.text: To ensure fertilization with the sperm of the best fathers

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of the disposable penis tip in black widow spiders?

options.label: A
options.text: To block the attempts of rival males

multiple-choice.question: What is the function of the syringe-like penis in bed bug males?

options.label: A
options.text: To inject sperm cells directly into the female's belly

multiple-choice.question: Why do females have evolved an entirely new set of genitalia on their right hand flanks in some bed bug species?

options.label: C
options.text: To create genetic variability among their offspring

multiple-choice.question: What is the shape of the duck vagina?
What is the purpose of the long, counterclockwise coiled penis in ducks?

options.label: D
options.text: To block the attempts of rival males

multiple-choice.question: What is the main reason why genitalia in various species have evolved into complex shapes?

multiple-choice.question: What is the origin of the term "vampire"?
What disease was often misinterpreted as vampirism in medieval times?
Who was the historical figure that the character of Dracula was loosely based on?

options.label: A
options.text: Vlad III Dracula, or Vlad the Impaler

title: Secrets of the X chromosome - Robin Ball

multiple-choice.question: What is the unique characteristic of the 23rd pair of chromosomes in humans?

options.label: A
options.text: They contain genes for both male and female development.

options.label: B
options.text: They are the X and Y chromosomes, which influence biological sex.

options.label: C
options.text: They contain genes for only male development.

options.label: D
options.text: They are the 22nd pair of chromosomes.

multiple-choice.question: What is the reason for the human body to function without duplicates of X chromosome genes?

options.label: B
options.text: To solve the problem of X inactivation.

options.label: D
options.text: Because of the evolution of the human body.

multiple-choice.question: What is the process called when each cell inactivates one X chromosome early in development?
Why is X inactivation random?

options.label: A
options.text: Because it is controlled by the parents.

options.label: B
options.text: Because it is controlled by the individual.

options.label: C
options.text: Because it is a natural process.

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of X inactivation in cells that express the maternal X chromosome?

options.label: A
options.text: The cells will express the paternal X chromosome.

options.label: B
options.text: The cells will be affected by the mutation.

options.label: C
options.text: The cells will display the trait from the maternal X chromosome.

options.label: D
options.text: The cells will be unaffected by the mutation.

multiple-choice.question: Why do calico cats have patches?
What is why some individuals with two X chromosomes may have a less severe disorder.
What is the result of X inactivation in individuals with only one X chromosome?

options.label: A
options.text: They will only express the mutant copy of the gene.

options.label: B
options.text: They will only express the normal copy of the gene.

options.label: C
options.text: They will express both the mutant and normal copies of the gene.

options.label: D
options.text: They will be unaffected by the mutation.

multiple-choice.question: What is still not fully understood about X inactivation?

options.label: C
options.text: How some genes on the X chromosome escape inactivation.

multiple-choice.question: What does X inactivation reveal about the complexity of gene expression?

options.label: A
options.text: That genes alone determine our traits.

options.label: B
options.text: That X inactivation is the only mechanism of gene expression.

options.label: C
options.text: That genes alone don't tell our whole story.

options.label: D
options.text: That X inactivation is not important for gene expression.

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.label: B

options.label: C

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary function of histamine in the process of itching?

options.label: C

options.label: B
options.text: To trigger a signal carried up the spinal cord to the brain

multiple-choice.question: According to the leading theory, what is the evolutionary purpose of the itch?

options.label: B
options.text: To deal with risks from the outside world

options.label: C

title: Are Boys Smarter Than Girls?

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary difference in brain structure between males and females?

options.label: A
options.text: Males have more connections within hemispheres, while females have more connections between hemispheres.

options.label: B
options.text: Males have a larger brain volume, while females have more brain folding.

options.label: C

options.label: D

title: Can you solve the virus riddle? - Lisa Winer

multiple-choice.question: What is the main problem presented in the scenario?

options.label: A
options.text: A research team has discovered a prehistoric virus and must destroy it before it spreads.

options.label: B
options.text: A group of people are trapped in a lab and must find a way to escape.

options.label: C
options.text: A virus has been released in a four-by-four compound, and someone must destroy it.

options.label: D
options.text: A lab has been knocked out by an earthquake, and the team must restart their experiment.

multiple-choice.question: What is the Hamiltonian path problem?

options.label: A
options.text: A problem that involves finding a route that visits every point within a graph exactly once.

options.label: B
options.text: A problem that involves finding a route that visits every point within a graph more than once.

options.label: C
options.text: A problem that involves finding a route that visits every point within a graph at random.

options.label: D
options.text: A problem that involves finding a route that visits every point within a graph in reverse order.

multiple-choice.question: Why is it impossible to find a Hamiltonian path in the given grid configuration?

options.label: A
options.text: Because the grid has an odd number of rooms on each side.

options.label: B
options.text: Because the grid has an even number of rooms on each side.

options.label: C
options.text: Because the grid has a random number of rooms on each side.

options.label: D
options.text: Because the grid has a different shape.

multiple-choice.question: What is the exception that allows for a successful route?

options.label: A
options.text: One can leave the entrance room without activating the switch and return to it after destroying either of the two adjacent rooms.

options.label: B
options.text: One can destroy the entrance room without activating the switch and return to it after destroying either of the two adjacent rooms.

options.label: C
options.text: One can leave the entrance room without activating the switch and destroy the two adjacent rooms.

options.label: D
options.text: One can destroy the entrance room without activating the switch and leave the two adjacent rooms.

multiple-choice.question: How many possible successful routes are there?
What is the result of the virus being released in the compound?

options.label: A
options.text: A small outbreak of the virus.

options.label: B
options.text: A large outbreak of the virus.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main challenge of the Hamiltonian path problem?

options.label: A
options.text: Finding a reliable formula or shortcut for finding a solution.

options.label: B
options.text: Determining whether a given graph has a Hamiltonian path.

multiple-choice.question: What is the significance of the grid configuration in the Hamiltonian path problem?

options.label: A
options.text: It makes it impossible to find a Hamiltonian path.

options.label: B
options.text: It makes it easy to find a Hamiltonian path.

options.label: C
options.text: It has no significance in the Hamiltonian path problem.

options.label: D
options.text: It makes it possible to find a Hamiltonian path.

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of activating the switch in a contaminated room?

options.label: A
options.text: The room is destroyed, and one cannot return to it.

options.label: B
options.text: The room is not destroyed, and one can return to it.

options.label: C
options.text: The room is not destroyed, but one cannot return to it.

options.label: D
options.text: The room is destroyed, and one can return to it.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main advantage of the exception that allows for a successful route?

options.label: A
options.text: It allows one to destroy the entrance room without activating the switch.

options.label: B
options.text: It allows one to leave the entrance room without activating the switch.

options.label: C
options.text: It allows one to return to the entrance room after destroying either of the two adjacent rooms.

options.label: D
options.text: It allows one to destroy the two adjacent rooms without activating the switch.
